typeparam.name: T
typeparam.span: 指定链接列表的元素类型。

span.span: Specifies the element type of the linked list.

summary.span: 表示双重链接列表。

span.span: Represents a doubly linked list.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种通用的链接列表。 is a general-purpose linked list. 它支持枚举器并实现 接口，与 .NET Framework 中的其他集合类一致。It supports enumerators and implements the interface, consistent with other collection classes in the .NET Framework. 提供 类型的单独节点，因此插入和移除操作是 O （1）操作。 provides separate nodes of type , so insertion and removal are O(1) operations. 您可以删除节点并将其重新插入到同一列表或其他列表中，这样就不会在堆上分配额外的对象。You can remove nodes and reinsert them, either in the same list or in another list, which results in no additional objects allocated on the heap. 由于此列表还维护内部计数，因此获取 属性是 O （1）操作。Because the list also maintains an internal count, getting the property is an O(1) operation. 对象中的每个节点都属于 类型。Each node in a object is of the type . 由于 是双重链接的，因此每个节点都指向 节点并向后指向 节点。Because the is doubly linked, each node points forward to the node and backward to the node. 当同时创建节点及其值时，包含引用类型的列表的性能会更好。Lists that contain reference types perform better when a node and its value are created at the same time. 接受 `null` 作为引用类型的有效 属性，并允许重复值。 accepts `null` as a valid property for reference types and allows duplicate values. 如果 为空，则 和 属性包含 `null`。If the is empty, the and properties contain `null`. 类不支持链接、拆分、循环或其他功能，这些功能会使列表处于不一致状态。The class does not support chaining, splitting, cycles, or other features that can leave the list in an inconsistent state. 列表在单个线程上保持一致。The list remains consistent on a single thread. 支持的唯一多线程方案是多线程读取操作。The only multithreaded scenario supported by is multithreaded read operations. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示了 类的许多功能。The following code example demonstrates many features of the class. [!code-cpp[Generic.LinkedList#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Generic.LinkedList/cpp/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Generic.LinkedList#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Generic.LinkedList/cs/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Generic.LinkedList#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Generic.LinkedList/vb/source.vb#1)]

threadsafe.span: 此类型不是线程安全的。

span.span: This type is not thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 如果 需要由多个线程访问，你将需要实现自己的同步机制。

span.span: If the needs to be accessed by multiple threads, you will need to implement their own synchronization mechanism.

threadsafe.span: 只要没有修改集合， 就可以同时支持多个读取器。

span.span: A can support multiple readers concurrently, as long as the collection is not modified.

threadsafe.span: 尽管如此，枚举集合本身并不是一个线程安全的过程。

span.span: Even so, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.

threadsafe.span: 在具有写入访问的枚举竞争的罕见情况下，必须在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。

span.span: In the rare case where an enumeration contends with write accesses, the collection must be locked during the entire enumeration.

threadsafe.span: 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。

span.span: To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization.

Public Function GetEnumerator () As LinkedList(Of T).Enumerator

summary.span: 返回遍历 的枚举器。

span.span: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the .
An for the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks C#语言的 `foreach` 语句（`for each` 中C++`For Each` Visual Basic）隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 之前， 返回相同的对象。 returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，则枚举器将定位到集合中的最后一个元素之后， 返回 `false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对 的后续调用也将返回 `false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果对的最后一个调用 返回 `false`，则 未定义。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举器就仍有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合所做的更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举器将失效且不可恢复，并且对 或 的下一次调用引发了 。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 不同步 中集合的默认实现。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 O （1）操作。This method is an O(1) operation.

summary.span: 获取一个值，用于指示 是否为只读。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether the is read-only.

span.span: if the is read-only; otherwise, .

value.span: 在 的默认实现中，此属性始终返回 。

span.span: In the default implementation of , this property always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在创建只读集合后，该集合不允许添加、移除或修改元素。A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created. 只读集合就是一个集合，其中包含阻止修改集合的包装器;因此，如果对基础集合进行了更改，只读集合将反映这些更改。A collection that is read-only is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks C#语言的 `foreach` 语句（`for each` 中C++`For Each` Visual Basic）隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 之前， 返回相同的对象。 returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，则枚举器将定位到集合中的最后一个元素之后， 返回 `false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对 的后续调用也将返回 `false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果对的最后一个调用 返回 `false`，则 未定义。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举器就仍有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合所做的更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举器将失效且不可恢复，并且对 或 的下一次调用引发了 。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 不同步 中集合的默认实现。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 O （1）操作。This method is an O(1) operation.

MemberSignature.Value: ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean Implements ICollection.IsSynchronized

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示是否同步对 的访问（确保线程安全）。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether access to the is synchronized (thread safe).

value.span: 如果对 的访问是同步的（线程安全），则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if access to the is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, .

value.span: 在 的默认实现中，此属性始终返回 。

span.span: In the default implementation of , this property always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不同步 中集合的默认实现。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 返回一个对象，该对象可用于同步对 的访问。 returns an object that can be used to synchronize access to the . 仅当所有线程在访问集合之前锁定此对象时，同步才有效。Synchronization is effective only if all threads lock this object before accessing the collection. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks C#语言的 `foreach` 语句（`for each` 中C++`For Each` Visual Basic）隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，则枚举器将定位到集合中的最后一个元素之后， 返回 `false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对 的后续调用也将返回 `false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果对的最后一个调用 返回 `false`，则 未定义。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举器就仍有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合所做的更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举器将失效且不可恢复，并且对 或 的下一次调用引发了 。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 不同步 中集合的默认实现。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 O （1）操作。This method is an O(1) operation.
